episodeTitle: Admiral Kizaru's Fierce Assault! The Straw Hats Face Certain Death!
description: The Straw Hats find themselves in a desperate situation as Admiral Kizaru prepares to execute Zoro. Rayleigh arrives just in time to block the attack and hold off the Admiral. Despite this intervention, the crew remains overwhelmed by Sentomaru and the Pacifista units. Chopper unleashes his Monster Point in desperation, but the real Bartholomew Kuma appears and uses his Devil Fruit power to make Zoro vanish, shocking the crew to their core.

events.title: Usopp and Brook Attempt to Save Zoro
events.description: With Zoro pinned down and unable to move as Kizaru's leg glows with light energy preparing to execute him, Usopp desperately fires multiple shots at the Admiral while Brook charges in with his sword to attack. However, both attacks pass harmlessly through Kizaru's body due to his Logia-type Pika Pika no Mi Devil Fruit.
events.significance: Demonstrates the overwhelming power gap between the Straw Hats and an Admiral. Despite their desperation and loyalty to their nakama, Usopp and Brook's attacks are completely ineffective against Kizaru's light-based powers.

events.title: Rayleigh's Dramatic Entrance - Blocks Kizaru's Attack
events.description: Just as Kizaru is about to deliver the killing blow to Zoro with a light kick, Silvers Rayleigh appears out of nowhere and kicks the light beam away, saving Zoro's life. Kizaru steps off Zoro and immediately recognizes the legendary pirate. Rayleigh orders Kizaru to let the Straw Hats go, but Kizaru refuses, stating he has come under instructions from the Celestial Dragons.
events.significance: One of the most iconic moments in the Sabaody Archipelago arc. Rayleigh's intervention marks the first time the Straw Hats receive help from a figure of such legendary status. The scene establishes Rayleigh's incredible speed and power, as he can keep pace with an Admiral.

quotes.text: Don't you think it's too early for them to head to the New World?
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Speaking to Kizaru after blocking his attack

quotes.text: I have come here under the instructions of the Celestial Dragons. I cannot simply leave.
quotes.speaker: Kizaru
quotes.context: Refusing Rayleigh's request to let the Straw Hats go

events.title: Rayleigh vs Kizaru - Legendary Battle Begins
events.description: Rayleigh and Kizaru engage in direct combat. Kizaru attempts to use Yata no Kagami to pursue the Straw Hats, but Rayleigh intercepts him with his sword. Kizaru creates the Ama no Murakumo, a sword made of light, and the two legendary fighters clash. Their battle demonstrates that Rayleigh, despite his age, can match an Admiral in combat.
events.significance: This battle proves that the legends of the previous generation are not just stories - Rayleigh can hold his own against one of the Navy's most powerful fighters. The fight buys crucial time for the Straw Hats, though it won't be enough to save them all.

events.title: Luffy Orders the Crew to Retreat
events.description: Recognizing the impossible situation they're in, with multiple enemies they cannot defeat and crew members already severely injured, Luffy makes the painful decision to order his crew to run away. This is one of the first times Luffy has ever ordered a full retreat, showing his growth as a captain who must prioritize his crew's survival.
events.significance: A watershed moment for Luffy's character development. For someone who typically charges forward regardless of the odds, ordering a retreat demonstrates maturity and the weight of responsibility as captain. It also emphasizes just how dire the situation has become.

quotes.text: Everyone, run! We can't win this fight!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Ordering his crew to retreat for the first time

events.title: Sentomaru Attacks Luffy with Ashigara Dokoi
events.description: As the Straw Hats attempt to escape, Sentomaru intercepts Luffy and uses his powerful Ashigara Dokoi technique - a devastating palm thrust that sends Luffy flying backward. The attack demonstrates Sentomaru's incredible physical strength and his mastery of a technique that can bypass even Luffy's rubber body.
events.significance: Establishes Sentomaru as a formidable fighter who can damage Luffy despite his Devil Fruit immunity to blunt attacks. This foreshadows the later revelation that Sentomaru uses Haki, though this isn't explicitly stated yet.

events.title: Pacifista PX-1 Blocks the Straw Hats' Escape
events.description: The Pacifista unit designated PX-1 positions itself to block the Straw Hats' escape route. Already battered from their previous fight with PX-4, the crew realizes they are trapped between Sentomaru, PX-1, and the battle between Rayleigh and Kizaru.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Navy's overwhelming tactical advantage. Even with Rayleigh's intervention, the Straw Hats cannot escape due to the coordinated efforts of multiple powerful enemies.

events.title: Chopper Transforms into Monster Point
events.description: Faced with the Pacifista preparing to fire and his crew in mortal danger, Chopper makes the desperate decision to consume multiple Rumble Balls, triggering his Monster Point transformation. In this massive, uncontrollable form, Chopper becomes a gigantic monster with incredible destructive power but loses all rational thought.
events.significance: The first time Chopper uses Monster Point since the Enies Lobby arc. This demonstrates the crew's absolute desperation - Chopper only uses this form as a last resort because he loses control and becomes a danger to friend and foe alike. It's a powerful visual representation of how hopeless the situation has become.

events.title: The Real Bartholomew Kuma Appears
events.description: Just as PX-1 prepares to fire on the Straw Hats, the real Bartholomew Kuma - the original Warlord of the Sea and not a Pacifista duplicate - materializes on the battlefield. He calmly orders the Pacifista to stand down, and the robot immediately complies, recognizing Kuma's authority.
events.significance: Kuma's appearance adds another layer of terror to the already desperate situation. Having fought PX-4 to exhaustion, the Straw Hats now face the original and presumably more powerful version. However, Kuma's true intentions remain mysterious.

events.title: Kuma Asks Zoro About Vacation Destination
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma calmly approaches the injured Zoro and asks him, 'If you could go anywhere for a vacation, where would you like to go?' This is the same question he asked before at Thriller Bark. Zoro, confused and injured, doesn't answer. The question seems surreal given the life-or-death situation.
events.significance: This cryptic question has deep meaning that won't be revealed for many episodes. It connects back to Kuma's encounter with the Straw Hats at Thriller Bark and foreshadows his true intentions. The calm, polite manner in which he asks contrasts sharply with the terror of the moment.

quotes.text: If you could go anywhere for a vacation, where would you like to go?
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Speaking to Zoro before making him disappear

events.title: Zoro Disappears - Kuma's Power Separates the Crew
events.description: Without waiting for an answer, Bartholomew Kuma removes his glove and slaps Zoro with his paw-padded hand. In an instant, Zoro completely vanishes in a bubble-like effect, seemingly vaporized. The crew watches in absolute horror and shock as their swordsman disappears before their eyes, with Luffy and the others screaming Zoro's name.
events.significance: This is the beginning of the Straw Hat crew's separation, one of the most traumatic events in the entire series. This moment marks the last time the crew will be together for 2 years of in-story time and hundreds of episodes. It fundamentally changes the trajectory of the series and launches the timeskip arc. For viewers, this is utterly shocking as Zoro appears to have been killed or erased from existence.

quotes.text: Don't you think it's too early for them to head to the New World?
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Speaking to Kizaru after saving Zoro

quotes.text: Everyone, run! We can't win this fight!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy

quotes.text: If you could go anywhere for a vacation, where would you like to go?
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Speaking to Zoro before making him disappear

quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Screaming in horror as Zoro vanishes

themes.description: The episode brutally demonstrates the Straw Hats' complete powerlessness against Admiral-level threats. Despite their growth and victories, they are utterly outmatched. Luffy's decision to retreat and Zoro's disappearance hammer home their vulnerability.
themes.symbolism: Zoro vanishing into thin air symbolizes the crew's dreams and unity being torn apart. The bubble-like effect represents the fragility of their bond in the face of overwhelming power.

themes.description: Luffy must make the painful decision to order a retreat, something that goes against his nature. As captain, he bears the responsibility of keeping his crew alive, even if it means running from a fight.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's command to retreat represents his growth from a reckless fighter to a responsible captain who understands when to fight and when to survive.

themes.description: The clash between Rayleigh and Kizaru represents the old generation (Roger's era) facing the new generation of Navy power. Rayleigh proves that legends don't fade easily, but his intervention alone isn't enough to save the day.
themes.symbolism: Rayleigh blocking Kizaru's light represents wisdom and experience standing against overwhelming force, buying time but unable to change the ultimate outcome.

themes.description: Chopper's Monster Point transformation represents the crew's willingness to sacrifice everything, even their own safety and sanity, to protect each other. It's an act of pure desperation.
themes.symbolism: Monster Chopper represents how desperation can transform people into something unrecognizable, losing themselves in the process.

characterSpotlights.development: Rayleigh demonstrates his incredible power by blocking Kizaru and engaging him in combat. His willingness to help the Straw Hats shows his investment in the new generation, particularly Luffy who wears his old captain's hat.
keyActions: Blocks Kizaru's killing blow on Zoro
Creates the Ama no Murakumo light sword clash
Holds off an Admiral despite his age
quotes: Don't you think it's too early for them to head to the New World?

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows tremendous growth by recognizing when the situation is unwinnable and ordering a retreat. This maturity as a captain contrasts with his usual headstrong approach. His scream when Zoro vanishes shows his emotional devastation.
keyActions: Orders crew to retreat for the first time
quotes: Everyone, run! We can't win this fight!

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma's appearance and actions remain enigmatic. His calm demeanor and cryptic question to Zoro contrast sharply with the terror his power induces. His true intentions remain unclear.
keyActions: Makes Zoro disappear with his Devil Fruit power
quotes: If you could go anywhere for a vacation, where would you like to go?

characterSpotlights.development: Already severely injured from the previous battles, Zoro is helpless when Kuma approaches. His disappearance marks the beginning of the crew's forced separation and his journey to become stronger.
Chopper's decision to use Monster Point shows how desperate the situation has become. He's willing to lose control and become a danger to everyone if it means protecting his crew.
keyActions: Loses rational thought in monstrous form

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the battle scenes between Rayleigh and Kizaru with additional animation
Additional reaction shots from the Straw Hats witnessing Zoro's disappearance were added

trivia.fact: Episode 404 adapts content from manga Chapters 511 and 512, marking the beginning of the crew's separation.
This is the final episode where all Straw Hat crew members are together until Episode 522, representing a 118-episode separation that lasts over 2 years in real-world broadcast time.

sources.title: What episode do the Straw Hat Pirates split up?

trivia.fact: The episode has an exceptional 9.5 rating on IMDB, reflecting its emotional impact and significance to the series.
Unshō Ishizuka voiced Admiral Kizaru in this episode. He would later be replaced by Ryōtarō Okiayu after Ishizuka's passing in August 2018.

sources.title: Ryotaro Okiayu Replaces Late Unshō Ishizuka as One Piece's Kizaru

trivia.fact: The opening song 'Share the World' by Tohoshinki celebrates One Piece's 10th Animation Anniversary, with the opening showing the Straw Hat members making a toast.

sources.title: Share the World - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The preview for Episode 405 is notably different from usual, being shorter and missing Luffy's traditional 'I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!' line, reflecting the somber tone.
This episode's animation quality was notably enhanced with better sakuga during the Rayleigh vs Kizaru scenes, with some calling it 'some of the best animation in the entire series till now.'
